meanings.definition: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
meanings.sent1: The witness saw the car crash happen.
meanings.sent2: The witness testified in court about what they saw.
meanings.sent3: The witness couldn't believe their eyes when they saw the magician make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The witness to the crime was like a silent observer in a play.
meanings.sent5: The witness's account of the incident was crystal clear.

meanings.definition: To see (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place.
meanings.sent1: I witness the sunrise every morning.
meanings.sent2: She witnessed the robbery while walking home.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to witness the chaos in the house with amusement.
meanings.sent4: The old tree has witnessed many storms over the years.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the dance performance was a breathtaking experience.

meanings.definition: To provide evidence or proof of something.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the weapon can witness his guilt.
meanings.sent2: She was willing to witness against the corrupt official.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing trash cans witness the negligence of the apartment residents.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers witness the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The signed document can witness the agreement between the parties.
